name: Mini Faded Serum for Dark Spots & Discoloration
about: What it is:A hyperpigmentation-safe serum that visibly reduces stubborn discoloration, post-blemish marks, scars, and spots—for all ethnicities and skin shades..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Dark Spots, Redness, and Acne and Blemishes.Formulation:Lightweight Cream.Highlighted Ingredients:- Tranexamic Acid: Visibly minimizes spots, dark patches, and post-blemish marks..Ingredient Callouts:This product is vegan, gluten-free, and cruelty-free..What Else You Need to Know:Visibly fade stubborn post-blemish marks, scars, dark patches, discoloration, and uneven skin tone resulting from breakouts and sun damage with this dermatologist-tested serum. Gentle enough for daily use, it produces visible results in as little as two weeks and is safe for all skin tones and ethnicities..Clinical Results:In a study with 32 participants aged 29 to 55, after 4 weeks:
ingredients: -Tranexamic Acid: Helps reduce the look of dark patches and post-blemish marks..-Niacinamide: Reduces the look of discoloration and uneven skin tone..-Azelaic Acid: Visibly brightens the skin tone, improves the evenness of skin texture, reduces the look of blemishes, and offers antioxidant support...Water/Aqua/Eau, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Glycerin, Niacinamide, Glyceryl Stearate, Tranexamic Acid, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Alpha-Arbutin, Behenyl Alcohol, Kojic Acid Dipalmitate, Gluthathione, Turmeric Butter, Ethylene Brassylate, Dimethylmethoxy Chromanyl Palmitate, Azelaic Acid, Glycyrrhiza Uralensis (Licorice) Root Extract, Melatonin, Phytic Acid, Squalane, Allantoin, Centella Asiatica Leaf Extract, Tocopherol, Arginine, Lecithin, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Sterols, Cetyl Palmitate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sclerotium Gum, Zinc Ricinoleate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Sodium Lauroyl Sarcosinate, Tetrahydroxypropyl Ethylenediamine, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Ceteareth-12, Ceteareth-20, Phenoxyethanol...Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up-to-date list of ingredients.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply a thin, even layer to cleansed, dry skin before moisturizing and after toning..-Use all over your face or on areas with the most discoloration and uneven tone..-Gently massage into skin until absorbed..-Use once weekly, working up to daily use..-Use sun protection during the day and moisturize well.

I’ve been using this for over a week now and I have definitely seen some improvements on old scars. They’ve lightened up a bit and overall my skin tone looks more even. The reviews are generally correct, it does smell like rotten eggs but just use it before bed then you don’t have to worry about anyone smelling your stinky face. 😉 anyway I plan to repurchase when I run out it’s pricey but worth it

reviews.review_text: I am skeptical of most skin care products doing any wonders on my stubborn skin. For reference, I had severe cystic and hormonal acne…. I am approaching my 30s and it’s not as rampant but has left pitted scars. I have used this product for 4 days total, and had ALREADY seen a drastic difference after only 2 days. It is drying, and I believe it is recommended to use 1x per week, but given my circumstances I am willing to see what happens with continued daily use!!! I have been keeping my skin extra hydrated with the purple Tacha moisturizer so I don’t look too crazy while I begin this journey. My skin is transforming before my eyes and I’m feeling pretty enough without makeup :) acne is shrinking and skin is brightening! I am stocking up FOR SURE with this Sephora sale! Permanent staple and a great brand

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Seriously amazing product despite the smell! I have dark spots from cystic acne and have been using tretinoin for months. While the acne has faded, the dark spots have been more stubborn.  What drew me to this product was the various ingredients packed into it. I was interested in azelaic acid and niacinamide and find it convienient to only use one product. Also love how it has lesser known ingredients like licorice root.   It does have a funky smell, and it does linger a bit, but it’s worth it! It’s pretty much unavoidable with these ingredients.   It also took about a month to start seeing results. A little slower than advertised. I do notice my skin is a lot brighter and clear the morning after I use it. Before and after photo included!

reviews.review_title: Worked but is too intense for me.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I bought the mini tube and I'm glad I did. I am barely half way through and will likely stop using this. I have hyperpigmentation from sun damage/melasma on my forehead and cheeks. I have used this 1 to 3 times a week for 2 to 3 months and noticed a good change on my forehead but when I place this product on my cheeks it feels too intense and my eyes feel irritated though I'm careful to not apply it close to them, I usually have to wash it off after 2 hrs. The smell is not awful, it's like between an egg and the lifting serum for lash lifts. it dries down and dissappear after applying moisturizer, I also applied the product with a Q tip so it wouldnt transfer to my fingers. The metal tube did not break on me, I kept it in the original box.  I think it is a good product, not for everyone and I would prefer to find something less irritating for myself.

reviews.review_title: Do a test on skin first don’t just use immediately
reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Broke my skin out in hives. Be very careful using this. If you have sensitive skin or allergies to any of the ingredients in this product please do NOT use. Do a test on skin first. I know sometimes we may forget to do that but will be very helpful to you in the long run. Everything is NOT for everyone. I love the brand and love the lip product but this one is a no. Hopefully they can make a similar product that is less harsh on the skin for ppl looking to have similar results in terms of fading dark spots.

reviews.review_text: I have been using it for over a month and it works amazingly. I see a lot of people complain about the smell, personally, I love the smell. I noticed my skin is brighter, and more even than ever! My skin did purge for maybe 2-3 weeks but I pushed through that. Some people complain that it broke them out after one use and it's your skin purging not necessarily an allergic reaction but it is hard to tell the two apart. When introducing a new product especially one like this your skin will react to it.   I will be purchasing again and even bigger one too! I will say there is a big price difference between the website and app. App says the mini is $24.50 and the Sephora website says different. There needs to be a change in the app to match the website or I will purchase directly from Topicals myself.

reviews.review_text: So first off, I’m a regular person that spent their own money to get this. It wasn’t working until I realized I was using it incorrectly. You apply a small thin layer, then moisturizer, and lastly sunscreen. I had gotten bitten by a bed bug on my face and it left a dark spot above my eyebrow. I’ve been using this consistently everyday day using the moisturizer and sunscreen and the DIFFERENCE is real. If I had to rate how light it has gotten outta 10, I would give it a 8.5. Be consistent with it, it definitely works and I 100% recommend this.

reviews.review_title: My one and only holy grail
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Best brightening serum HANDS DOWN. I've tried AHAs, vitamin C, alpha arbutin, niacinamide, adapalene, and other brightening treatments, and none of them have made any noticeable impact on my dark spots. After a few weeks of using the Faded serum, I am feeling so much more confident about my skin. I stopped using other acids in my routine because this stuff is really good at exfoliating without drying. My skin is smoother and my dark spots are finally fading! The smell is odd, but the benefits outweigh it by far. My skin plays nicely with acids, so I use this both morning and night. But I would definitely recommend starting out slow if you have sensitive skin. I also recommend using a moisturizer with ceramide and other skin barrier protecting ingredients.

It is hard to say how effective it is on it's own since I use it in rotation with a ton of other stuff ( i.e. retinal, AHAs, licorice root, vit c. etc etc).   AS for the smell, no it doesn't smell great but all the complaining about it is WAY overblown. It smells like sulfur, You put it on and it goes away. I'd rather it be a little stinky than loaded with sensitizing fragrances and essential oils that only cause irritation and make things worse.  The price sucks, but for what you get it's probably reasonable. A tube of Finacea costs about the same or more.

reviews.review_text: I really wanted to like this product, I had heard good things about it and appreciate the brand as a whole. Almost everything about this product is a Terrible user experience. I've been using it since November 23 (now Feb 24), and I have noticed some results but no more than other fading products/vitamin C's I've used (if anything less). This product has THE WORST SMELL I have ever put on my face. I expected some sort of smell based on other reviews, but it literally smelled like nasty wet cat food. Just awful. And the packing is just as terrible. It's impractical and wasteful!! When I first started using it, product would just POUR out without any control. I literally lost SO much product because there was no way of stopping it. Then once you start getting towards the end of product use, it's impossible to get product out without creating HOLES IN THE PACKAGING. They need to rethink packaging at minimum, but truly there are better products out there for acne scars, dark spots and textures. It's way pricier, but the U Beauty Resurfacing serum is going to do the same, if not more, for your skin, last just as long if not longer, and won't come with so many downsizes (prices really being the only one). Not worth it.

reviews.review_title: Very harsh product but fades dark spots
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: On one hand, I do notice my hyperpigmentation fading more and more each week. At the same time, it’s causing me to break out more which leads to more hyperpigmentation in the future. My skin usually isn’t very sensitive so at first I was using this every other day but that was a horrible idea. That gave me small chemical burns and my skin was so raw, dry, and stung all day. I won’t fault them for that cause the directions do say to start off with it once a week but I was impatient and saw other people say their skin did well with everyday use right off the bat and I thought I could do the same. I focused on hydration for a while to restore my skin barrier and then incorporated it back into my routine once a week and I’m still having similar issues. I used this product the same night after plucking my brows during the day (I only plucked like 3 hairs) and woke up with a bunch of little white dots all around my eyebrow. They went away in a two days but it was nasty looking. Then I applied this a little too close to my ear since I have hyperpigmentation on my jawline and now my earlobe and behind my ear has the same little white spots and it’s lasted for days now. It stings too. And my nose seems to be the most sensitive part of my face cause it’s gotten really dry, and started peeling a lot. If you’re gonna try this product, make sure your skin barrier is already healthy and use a very small amount. I’d also recommend going to sleep with a sealant on (Cerave healing ointment is great). Not a horrible product but a product you definitely need to be VERY careful with. Although it’s helped with my dark spots, I feel it’s not worth it for me and that there’s definitely more gentle products on the market that will help with my dark spots. Wouldn’t recommend but I wouldn’t discourage anyone from trying either because everyone’s skin is different! Just be very careful with any acids.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve been reading the comments on this product and I wanted to share my opinion on it. I’ve been using this product for about 2 years now and I can definitely agree with everyone it has a really bad smell. It’s also true that this causes breakouts at the start, but the more consistently you use it the better it gets. I’ve been doing skin cycling with this product because I’m scared to use retinol, but I have really dry skin so before putting this product on I make sure to have my hyaluronic acids on before I put this on my skin. Then if it still feels particularly dry afterwards I go in with a heavy cream like vanicream to ensure that the moisturizer stays locked and so do the active products. I know at first it can break you out and stuff but, keep trying it for a month at least before throwing it out. I promise it does make a difference. I used to have really bad acne marks but this product has helped out a lot! I would like to mention I only use this at night. During the day I use a vitamin C and sunscreen!

reviews.review_title: Ruined My Skin! | More Dark Spots
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I made the mistake of adding this product to my face routine and it ruined my skin. My skin was beautiful before using, and many days I wear no makeup.   I started off with 1 application weekly as suggested. When I first applied my skin had a nice glow. The next morning I noticed 2-3 pimples forming on my forehead. You know the kind that hurts under the skin. Those same pimples all left dark spots. Tried using this product one more time. Again, I woke up with more pimples. My skin is now blotchy with 8 new dark spots, that will probably take months to disappear.  If you read reviews like me, and think eh these people are probably exaggerating. WE ARE NOT! Don’t buy or use this product if you love your skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm 50 yrs old and just started getting into skincare. When I first started, I jumped right into trying new products such as vitamin C and Tretinoin and boy let me tell you...my face was angry. I had so much clogged pores, pimples. I'm sure I was purging but it was bad and it doesn't help I'm a picker so now I have all of these scars. 6 months later, I think I finally found a good regimen. I no longer have clogged pores and I may get an occasional pimple but now I also have a lot of scares that I've never had before. I was using this serum with another serum and I kept breaking out and I thought it was this product but come to find out, it was the other product. Now I use this product along with my other skin regimen, no problem at all. I've been using it for a week and I am already seeing results. i know it will take time but this works. Yes, it has a weird smell but it doesn't last long. The only negative thing i have to say is the packing. I with they would put it in a pump or something or even change the tube material because it gets wrinkle and then it's hard to get product out. I'll keep using it for at least 3 months. Hope to see significant results by then.
After using for a week, I could see my dark spots fading. I’ll continue using it. It works for me. Excellent.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using this serum for a few years and I've loved it for a long time. It definitely helps clear hyperpigmentation and the smell doesn't stick around, the ingredient that gives is the funky smell is a great topical ingredient for hyperpigmentation. HOWEVER! This has been reformulated, a few times I think. And with the most recent reformulation, I've been getting clogged pores constantly. It took me a long time to figure out since I have been using it for ages and I didn't know it had been reformulated. I'm so disappointed! I don't know of an equivalent serum with the density of active ingredients, and at this price especially. What a shame, I wish it was still good for acne and clog prone skin.

reviews.review_title: Gamechanger - but the product packaging is bad!!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I began using this during COVID mask/maskne times and it was one of the very few things that helped my acne. Yes it has a strong smell but I personally got past it very fast as it settles into the skin quick. I haven't noticed a crazy change with hyperpigmentation, but it is a savior for acne. I've had acne prone skin my whole life and I swear using this at night makes zits disappear by the next morning (or at least reduce in size). It is magic. HOWEVER, the tube packaging is not great. Because of the material it's made with, when it's bent, the tube can actually crack open and form little holes where product escapes. This happened when I traveled the first time with it. So anytime I squeeze product to come out where it's actually supposed to, it also comes out in the little cracks on the tube where it has broken open. So much wasted product and then the product isn't as fresh. I ordered a new one despite this, and when I opened it a TON of product came gushing out that I obviously couldn't use at one time so there was more waste there, again I think due to the tube packaging. This is the best product but PLEASEEEE fix this!!!! I want to keep buying without wasting so much!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: for reference, i am 15, i have post acne marks, and normal skin. my hyperpigmentation is both new and old, but in this review i’ll be detailing my experience with this product regarding my newer dark spots, as those are easier to fade and i haven’t been using this product for too long.  i bought this product around three weeks ago, because i was very self conscious of my dark spots on my forehead. i had been wanting this product in the past to fade my (now older) dark spots, but didn’t think it was worth it. i was so wrong! this product is a miracle. i use it as a spot treatment every night, (i disregarded the rules indicating to use it 1-2 times per week to begin) and i’ve seen results so fast! not only is the smell very tolerable, i almost like the smell. it’s sweet, and yes, does faintly smell of eggs, but it’s not overpowering whatsoever.  i really struggled with my self esteem with my hyperpigmentation, and even though the spots are still there, they have faded so much that it genuinely makes me so happy.   i recommend pairing this product with la roche posay’s cicaplast baume and any AHA, such as glycolic acid 🩷🩷  if you’re waiting for a sign to buy this product, here it is!! i hope you see results as fast as i did 🫶🏻

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Disclaimer: I do use this in conjunction with glycolic and salicylic acid and it has really been helpful in improving my skin.  Pros: - Lasts a while! I bought the mini version (15ml) and have been using it more consistently since July and I'm not even halfway there. I use about to pea-size amounts. - Reduced the size of my pores, particularly around my nose area = smoother skin.  - Gentle on the skin. I would attribute that to the Centella Asiatica and the Niacinamide. I used it once a week for 3 weeks. Now I use it every other day and it hasn't made my sensitive skin flare up. - My acne scars are diminished due to the mix of tranexamic acid, azelaic acid, licorice root, and kojic acid. I had a really painful pimple on my cheek and I used this throughout the process of it growing and now it's nice and flat. The colour of the pimple went from pink to red to brownish-red and now beige.   Cons: - The smell. For me it isn't a bother, but I can see why others would be hesitant to use it if you're sensitive to smells. It smells like Sulfur and I've associated it with my old dog so it feels comforting for me.   Don't expect rapid results. Keep it consistent, as you should for all products anyway. There are definitely similar versions for cheaper, but the fact that the key ingredients are near the top of the list , it's gentle, and it works just make this product worth it. I highly recommend buying the small version to try it out first.

reviews.review_title: Broke me out & caused MORE scarring
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: *BEFORE using this product- gray shirt.  *AFTER the breakout-red shirt   I have suffered with scarring from teenage acne for years. After finally “aging out” of the horrible acne and not having a mass breakout in years, I started my dark spot treatment. I have tried numerous products and have paid a lot for expensive creams from dermatologist with no luck. I did a lot of research on Faded and was super excited to purchase.   I started using Faded after my serum & before my moisturizer in my skin care routine (applying sunscreen in the morning routine).  The first thing I noticed, was the smell. It is strong but I wasn’t bothered.  After just one use, my face was tingly, like a lemon was applied to it. Tolerable. I remember my dermatologist used to tell me new products take time to work so be consistent.  Day 2: I noticed a few small pimples on my chin where I had applied the product on an old acne scar. After washing my face in the pm, I noticed a a pimple on my cheek.  Day 3: I woke up on the third day of using Faded with my cheeks covered in small, nasty pimples.   I had not changed anything else in my routine or lifestyle expect adding Faded. I immediately stopped use of this product and the acne cleared up within a few days.  I have had no new breakouts since but the dark scars the breakout left are so disheartening:(  My self esteem is (still) crushed and I was completely devastated with the new acne scars I had worked so hard for years to get rid of. Because of Faded. I’m starting all over on my goal to have my scars faded.  I read another review posted the day after I bought my Faded saying the product seemed different in than usual and they broke out, too. My only confirmed allergen I was not an ingredient listed so I am still unsure as to what broke me out in this product.  My advice: be careful! Read the ingredients if you have may have any allergies and check with your dermatologist to see if this would work for you. Don’t make my mistake!

reviews.review_text: I have not been wowed by a product for a very very long time like I have with this. I have had cystic acne in my early 20's and got stuck with stubborn acne marks that wouldn't budge. I haven't seen change in my skin texture after one use so I'll be on the lookout for that next. The only dislike I have is the smell. It smells like medicine and I find it nauseating BUT I'll take it if it means it'll clear up my skin.

This is unfortunately not wearable for me because of the fragrance added. A lot of people complain about the pungent smell of the actives — which to me smells a bit like burned plastic — but that pungent smell dissipates very quickly. For me, it’s entirely gone once the product fully dries done, which takes about a minute.  However, what’s left behind is a really cloying, nauseating babydoll-head sugary rose scent that is STRONG. Strong enough that when I walked into the living room, my partner and my sister both asked what perfume I had put on. Because it’s right on your face, directly under your nose, it’s quite unbearable. It gave me a headache and for that reason, I couldn’t tell you if it works or not. I could only use it a few times before I had to give it up.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I LOVE this stuff! I have melasma on my forehead from years of tanning and not wearing SPF when I was young and ignorant, and I often get little dark marks from hormonal acne breakouts that take forever to fade . My skin is thick, I have large pores, some black heads on my nose and my skin is oily. I've been using a Benzoyl Peroxide/Retin A treatment called Tactupump Forte for quite some time to control my breakouts and I use it nightly. I wear SPF every single day. My skin can handle exfoliating or acid products pretty well. I jumped into Faded head first and applied it every night for 2 days without Tactupump Forte but applied them together every night afterwards. I know my skin and I knew I would not have any issues - I know what signs to look for if the product started to irritate my skin. I had no issues using Faded every night. The treatment is quite thick so I apply it last before my night time moisturizer. It does have a strong sulphuric smell which honestly doesn't bother me, I'd rather something like this treatment  NOT fragranced. After 2 weeks of consistent use, to my shock and surprise, Faded has already started to work. I've been trying so much to even out my skin tone to no avail; I know products that lighten dark marks take time to work and I do set appropriate expectations. This is the only product that has delivered results within the mentioned timeframe and I am impressed. Additionally, my texture has become softened and I wake up with baby soft skin. To say I am obsessed is an understatement!

reviews.review_title: Don’t give up, results are around the corner
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: this product has helped with my skin a lot, for reference a 24 year old light skinned Latina with a terrible skin picking habit, my acne only really got bad during my period but then I got random huge under the skin zits on/off my period. When I wouldn’t pop them it would still leave a dark spot. I also would get those little annoying bumps on my forehead and sometimes nose. Tried everything to help my skin heal from the damage I have done to it for years, until I stumbled upon this product. I didn’t really see real big results until almost 6 months in. By 3 months tho I saw a few changes, my smaller dark spots faded away completely and no more little bumps also WEAR SUNSCREEN. Really helps you see results faster honestly just stay out of the sun completely. I see a lot of comments about the smell it’s not that bad for a while I didn’t really smell anything until I really took a whiff.I gave up on it a few times because I was impatient but trust the process and keep using it, yes I know it made u break out and face worse but trust the process it’s all worth it. Probably feels like you have been using it forever and still see nothing. Been there. I love my skin!! I’ve never seen my skin so good. When you pass that purging phase and ur skin has finally settled and is taking in the amazing ingredients it’s gods work. Marks fading, no more huge zits and my face just looks brighter. Even during my period I don’t break out like crazy I actually don’t get anymore pimples. I don’t want to say acne free but acne free. This product has truly saved my skin so good I don’t even mind spending 40$ on it. Give it a chance it might just change ur skin forever 2

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: The cult favorite Faded serum has a ton of brightening ingredients: niacinamide, tranexamic acid, alpha arbutin, azelaic acid, glutathione, licorice, melatonin, and turmeric. Centella provides soothing, and shea butter, jojoba oil, coconut oil, and glycerin hydrate. There are no added fragrances or dyes, but it does have that salty smell that I associate with some vitamin C products, although that dissipates quickly. The texture is creamy, which initially worried me, but to my shock it did not clog my pores at all, and it caused no irritation. After using the serum for a few weeks, I can definitely tell that my post-acne marks are fading (ha!), and at a faster rate than normal. This serum would be great for folks with dry skin, or dehydrated skin like me.

reviews.review_text: For reference, I have eczema/oily prone skin. I used to struggle with acne and the resulting acne scarring/hyperpigmentation.  This has been an amazing night time serum. Emphasis on the night time usage because YES IT SMELLS, I've just personally gotten used to it. I use this a few nights a week depending on my skin needs. I always wake up with a soft, refreshed, and brightened face. I used up my first tube in 2022 after about 6 months of applying a dime sized amount of serum all over my face nightly. It lightened my acne scars and made them appear pink before fading away.   For transparencies sake, I also use SPF 50 every day. By my 2nd tube, I began to include other active ingredients/skin barrier protecting products intermittently to accommodate eczema flare ups and acne breakouts. I recommend using a paint tube key to best dispense the product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve tried Topicals Faded Serum, and I was so impressed with the results! This innovative serum is specifically designed to address hyperpigmentation, post-blemish marks, scars, and spots with a lightweight cream that is safe for all skin tones and ethnicities. After using it for a couple of weeks, I noticed that my dark spots, redness, and acne and blemishes had begun to lighten and even out my skin tone. The key ingredients, tranexamic acid, niacinamide, and azelaic acid, work together to reduce discoloration and address post-acne marks. I also love that this serum is vegan, gluten-free, and cruelty-free. I would highly recommend Topicals Faded Serum for anyone looking to address stubborn discoloration or improve their skin tone.

I hadn’t noticed before use that it contains ceteareth-20 plus cetearyl alcohol, which can be problematic for folks with oily skin that is prone to clogged pores.

The powerhouse of ingredients is staggering:  Tranexamic acid manages melasma, brightens  Melatonin anti inflammatory reduces dark spots  Niacinamide anti inflammatory refines pore, limits oil Licorice root brightens, acne care Azelaic acid hyperpigmentation, brightens smoothes  Centella anti inflammatory antioxidant soothes  spot treat or apply all over *Don’t mix with AHA’s BHA’s or Retinols* Gentle for daily use, but start slow 1x/wk. I’ve been using every other night.  What it does? Evens, balances, smoothes, brightens, fades spots, marks, scars Glutathione gives a sulfur smell (cysteine chain)brightens, reduces discolouration. Eczema & pregnancy safe all skin types tones  alcohol free, no synthetic dyes, vegan & cruelty free  results in 2 weeks, on cleansed dry skin and moisturize 5/5

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: First off, it stank fr. I just don’t enjoy the smell. It’s lowkey rancid. But it’s fine because I don’t need to only use my nose to breathe. Two, the results are actually great. I don’t use this by itself so my skin results in almost two months are probably contributed by the effects of my other products as well, but as this product is for dark spot and discoloration, it has done it’s thing on that! It’s only been a month and some change (almost two in a week and few days) and my skin is already brighter & there are spots that are fading. It says to use once a week and then build up using it daily, but I got a lil’ impatient. It started off as me using it once for two weeks, then started using it day and night every time I do my AM & PM skin routine. Anyways yeah, besides the smell.. I got no complaints. I took the picture the same place, same lighting. Only difference is when I first took the pic in March, my face isn’t moisturized.   Here’s the rest of my skin routine, if anybody is interested (:  1.) Good Molecules Clarify & Cleanse Bar Soap (Cleanser) 2.) Healov’s Tumeric Face Wash Liquid (Cleanser)  3.) Good Molecules Niacinamide Brightening Toner (Toner) 4.) First Aid Beauty Ultra Repair Cream (Moisturizer) 5.) Faded Tropicals (Serum) 6.) TheInkeyList Omega Water Cream (Moisturizer) 7.) Mel\e Face Moisturizer with SPF (Sunscreen)  Those are the items for both my AM & PM routine. the PM is the same as AM just without the sunscreen (7).   It seems like a lot (and i’m not sure if it is, prolly cus I double cleanse), but it’s def worth it and works for my skin. The sunscreen is a DEF recommended though for melanated skin.

reviews.review_text: Okay, as someone who has been dealing with relatively large and very visible dark spots on my face since august 2022, I’m going to cover everything I would have wanted to see in a review.  1: The dark spots I’m referring to are two relatively large areas on my face that came from a breakout I had July 2022. I have one splotch in each cheek. Before turning to spots they were two large bruise looking scabs and me being me I peeled off the scabs making them larger, more painful, bloody, and take forever to heal. I tried everything from aloe Vera, to aquophor, to Ambi fade cream and these things worked but slowly and they didn’t really do what I needed. I discovered good molecules and I owe my life to their discoloration serum and brightening toner. I’ve even incorporated their retinol and pineapple exfoliate in my routine and these products have done SO MUCH for my skin. These products did most of the heavy lifting in fading my dark spots.   2: fast forward to earlier this month. My products have been working fine but I felt like they weren’t powerful enough to fully fade my spots. They were still visible and I really just wanted them to go away. I’ve been stalking so to speak faded by topicals for months but I kept shying away because I heard things about it breaking people out. I finally decided that I was just going to have to take the risk because the results I kept seeing were amazing. I bought it and started using it last Monday.  3. Today is Sunday so tomorrow will make 1 week of me using it. To minimize irritation I cut my routine down to cleansing and spf in the morning ( with STRICT reapplication) and cleansing, faded andmoisturizer at night. I didn’t follow the instructions and I know I definitely took a risk with that but I’ve been so desperate. I used it every night. I did get a mini breakout but it calmed down pretty fast 4: So far I see a HUGEEEEE difference. At this rate, I think they’ll be 90% gone in two weeks. I’m going to update my review.

reviews.review_text: I have yet to try the product, hence the four stars but I want to make this really clear for anybody who comes across this review. I got my faded serum just right now and I immediately opened it and spread it on my hand to see how it smells because of how many bad comments that are on here relentlessly ranting talking ish about the smell. And when I tell you everyone is over exaggerating I mean THEIR OVER-EXAGGERATING, this product doesn’t smell like tulips and fresh strawberries BUT it certainly doesn’t smell like harsh chemical throw up that will burn your nose hairs. In addition, this won’t even give off a strong smell to someone laying right next to you unless they are right in your face sniffing your skin which I hope y’all ain’t doing that. 😂 I’m just stunned at how bad people think this smells, I would even go as far to say as I like the unnoticeable neutral scent it has because it’s a very normal cream scent and dried up in a matter of minutes very nicely with little stickiness. Anyways though, I’ll have a real honest update about this in about 3 months, I currently have a lot of red & purpley brown hyperpigmentation from my acne so we’ll see.

reviews.review_text: I’ve used my entire tube. I have acne prone normal skin (not oily, just hormonal acne prone). I tend to have clear skin 2 weeks out of the month and have a few small breakouts for the remaining. This causes me to have redness & PIE/PIH, mostly in my chin and occasionally on my cheeks. I found that this doesn’t clear or fade my redness/PIH as quickly as other products. I can get past the smell of the product really works. I also think this isn’t good for acne prone skin, as it has shea butter as the 7th ingredient. I love that it has TXA and licorice root but I do think this has added to my breakouts therefor cancelling out and effects it had on fading spots on my face. I will probably not repurchase as I can’t risk this continuing to break me out. Maybe this will work better for someone who doesn’t have acne prone skin.

reviews.review_text: Used this 3x last week and has already made a big difference in fading the melasma on my upper lip.  Normally I have to try and cover it, and it still ends up showing. But it’s now to a point where it can be covered with liquid foundation alone.  Just a small amount is all you need and honestly the smell didn’t bother me once I put my lotion on top of it.  Highly highly recommend!   I don’t however recommend using it 3x in a week for the first time - my skin is VERY tolerant and I knew that I’d likely be ok. But the recommendation is 1x a week to start.

reviews.review_title: ease yourself in to prevent purge, great product
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: you definitely need to ease yourself into this product to avoid the purge, and the mini is more than enough to last a while. i used it once a week for about a month, then twice a week for a month, then 3, then every day (occasionally one day break). It took me a few months to ease in and it was worth the wait because it has been working so well at reducing my pigmentation but I also dont have to struggle with new pigmentation from purging. Usually purge phases turn me away from products but this one has everything ive been interested in trying lately all neatly packaged up so I am so happy I gave it shot! 4 stars bc i think a different packaging would be great.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I can't stress enough how much this stuff WORKS. I have BAD hyperpigmentation/melasma, that I have been working with an  esthetician with for approx 1.5 years. I've done peels, IPL, other random products. The only product that worked for me with my esthetician was one with hydroquinone. It was life changing, but you can only use it for a few months at a time and i was noting some of the hyperpigmentation was coming back when I stopped using it. I was skeptical of this but with everything you read about hydroquinone, I didn't want to have to keep relying on this, while also worrying if my hyperpigmentation would get worse, which can happen with that ingredient. Ive been using it for 2 weeks and its a game changer-- I promise you, try it! It's like Buckleys, it tastes awful but works, this smells awful, but works! My night routine- wash with ZO hydrating cleanser (not at sephora) or Tatcha Rice Wash Cleanser, hyaluronic acid, Topicals Faded Serum, Inky List 10% Azeliac Serum, and then Tatcha Indigo Night Repair

It did not cause any irritation like some products of this nature tend to cause and the smell is also not noxious. I really would recommend this product for any one with oily skin!

reviews.review_text: It works!! Give it time and use twice daily. Yeah it smells but from a melasma suffer￼er I couldn’t care less as long as it’s working which hallelujah it does. I mix this with some products from ordinary, and I can’t say enough good things. I have tried everything you can think of micro needling Venus Viva, facials, peels, IPL halo, you name it I have tried it for some reason this product combined with a few other from ordinary, works amazing.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I just want effective, well-formulated, fairly priced products...and this delivers. I somehow got 4 pimples under my right butt (folliculitis?) which I've never gotten before, so of course I picked at them and was worried the discoloration would last. It's been 6 weeks since I started using this, and not only is it non-irritating, but the texture is soothing and pleasant to apply. Moreover, the spots have faded significantly that they are almost non-perceptible. Cons are: horrible musty smell and not openly listing the % of the actives such as tranexamic acid, azelaic, kojic, etc. but I was able to find a report of it elsewhere online. Perhaps they did it to be able to tweak the formulation in the future, but I want a little more transparency. Ultimately, I plan on repurchasing to use on my face and elsewhere on my body if/when needed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately I did not experience any improvement in my hyperpigmentation after a month of use. I would have kept it up had there been at least a little change but I noticed no difference in my progress photos after 30 days of consistent use.   I know the mixed reviews don’t really help with making a purchase decision but thought I would share my lack of results. I would still recommend trying it to see if it works for you because it obviously helps some people!  The smell that everyone talks about is not that bad. If you have used Nair before, this is identical. I think it’s a totally acceptable downside of the product if you’re able to get good results from using this.   The texture of the product is really nice imo, and I liked the overall user experience, just wish it had done something for me! It did introduce me to the individual ingredients though and I am getting noticeable results from using The Ordinary azelaic acid suspension.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I never write reviews, however I felt like I needed to with this product. I've been currently struggling with adult acne. I usually get breakouts and they go away fast and easy, but as I got older it has become more difficult dealing with post acne scars. Granted my acne scars are not severe as other cases, but within the week I've been using Faded I have noticed a difference in my acne scars. They are not completely gone  but there is improvement and I can finally see the light at the end of this annoying acne tunnel. I have very sensitive skin so this does not irritate or burn my skin ( I have oily skin). I understand the smell can be intense but nothing I personally can't handle. It smells like nair. I believe sweet/floral scent face items actually cause my breakouts so I really appreciate that there's no intense sweet smell in this. If you can handle the smell I 100% recommend this.

It does seem to take time and consistent use (duh?). I will say, manage your expectations. This, alongside a good skincare routine will most likely improve your skin. I still have a ways to go til I see more progress. I'm not ruling it out. Also, the elephant in the room will be your skin. The scent seems to aim for floral/natural with an overwhelming dollop of sulphur. It isn't as bad as everyone says and if you put it on before bed, it doesn't matter anyway.

reviews.review_text: Do NOT get the mini. I got it yesterday and returned this size immediately after realizing how tiny it is. You're getting a much better deal with the full size. The product itself works well and has very, very good and potent ingredients for scarring and hyperpigmentation. I see a lot of people complaining about the scent but skincare products that have actives for discoloration (e.g: Vitamin C, other asorbic acids, ferulics, arbutin, hydroquinone) all tend to smell kind of pungent. Not a product flaw at all it's just the way it is unless you want it doused in fragrance. It is a very active-filled product is what I am trying to say! Not the best there is but a good budget option that has definitely given me results. Just don't get the mini.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: People really like to toss around the term holy grail, but this product embodies everything that means for me. This has become something I can't see living without. I'm on my second tube and it has absolutely transformed my skin. I have tried so many products for hyperpigmentation over the years and while some things kind of worked, I never saw measurable difference like with this product. It has visibly lightened stubborn age/sun spots and has brightened the overall appearance of my skin noticeably. It has also worked to keep my complexion even, which has always been a difficult task for any product as I have fair skin prone to unevenness. It smells like burnt hair, but I'll take it for the results and not having added fragrance to further aggravate my skin. I use it twice a day every day and I pray they don't ever discontinue or reformulate it.

I had to only use it in the morning (cause smelling this on my pillow at night was just horrible) I would apply, while holding my breath, then wash my hands and then put on a smelly hand cream. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The first few times I put this on, it smelled really bad like cigarette ash or something musty. Someone in the reviews said they didn't notice the smell lingering, but for me I still get whiffs of it for many hours after applying. The smell has grown on me and now I weirdly like the scent - it's hard to describe. The packaging is also not ideal for this product. It's a thinner viscosity than the type of products that are usually in aluminum squeeze tubes, so too much comes out and it dries in the cap. I wish it were a thicker cream for the price so I could use less. On the plus side, this list of ingredients in this is fantastic, and it does work about as well as a non-rx dark-spot treatment can. Tranexamic acid and these type of ingredients work best when used consistently over time and work well to prevent redness/dark spots before they occur as well as treat hyperpigmentation.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I used it first time last year but as i was still new to retinol back then i though maybe my skin needs exfoliation for Faded to work better. This year I bought it several months ago and have been using it religiously. Sadly i don't see any difference in hyperpigmentation caused by sun and acne etc. I really wanted it to work but I guess I need to continue my search for a product that really works for this hyperpigmentation.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really want to love this product but it hasn’t made a significant difference on my hyperpigmentation or dark marks sadly

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Barely started using this product and already see results. I have oily, aging skin with sun damage discoloration, will re-purchase!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: the first few times of trying this, I was a bit wowed, tbh. I would apply at night and in the morning I will find my face glowing. although the effect faded over time. I started using this once a week and worked my way up to everyday. I use it either night or morning. I am not seeing dramatic results yet though, I have dark eye circles and some freckles high on the cheeks, and some post pimples marks on my jaw. none of these discolourations have lightened so far after 2 months of almost daily use. but because the ingredients are so good and well researched, I just bought the full sized tube again. I am hoping I will see results in 4 months.  Re the smell that some find offensive, is not overpowering. the smell. while medicinal is not headache triggering or nauseating like perfumed creams are. I am actually highly sensitive to artificial smells and get nauseous and dizzy around strong perfumes, but this cream is absolutely fine with me. If you use this cream as a treatment expecting medicinal smell, you will be fine.  also, a small tube lasts quite a long time.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I am still trying to get used to the smell. If you have ever smelled canned cat food or shiritaki noodles before, it’s a very similar scent and it’s very nauseating BUT this product does wonders for my skin. My skin feels amazing in the morning and I’m starting to see a difference in my skin tone and scars. The smell makes me want to throw-up first thing in the morning but the benefits are worth it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This works not only on dark spots on your face but blemishes on the entire body.  It doesn't smell the greatest, however, the smell doesn't stay.  I've used this for months now, there's significant difference in blemishes I've had for years.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I heard such good things about this product. I was excited to use but it clogged my pores sooooo BAD and cause me to break out :((((

reviews.review_title: Smell may be distracting but this product is AMAZ
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I love this product, after I pop a pimple it normally scars. After using this mini size for about 3 months it has helped my scars so muchhhhh. You actually get used to the smell after a while, I kinda like it now...

reviews.review_title: DO NOT BUY! WILL BREAK YOU OUT!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Bought this product bc it kept showing up on my tiktok and when I tell you IT BROKE ME OUT SO BAD. I saw that it could cause you to purge bc it contains exfoliating ingredients so I did give it a chance and decided to use it for a month. After a month it was still breaking me out so SO bad (ur only supposed to purge for 3-4 weeks MAX) thats when I decided to finally stop and do my research. Found out that it contains so many pore clogging ingredients. I will say that it does (ever so lightly) reduce appearance of acne marks BUT will cause you to have more pimples…its all very counterproductive. You’re trying to lighten an acne mark and when ur finally able to at least make it less noticeable here you are stuck with a bunch MORE of new pimples that you’re now gonna have to heal and lighten again!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm not sure how well this works because I stopped using it. The reason why I stopped using it was that it was too strong for my skin and kept [t making me brake out not only to mention the scent. the scent is so bad it smells like Nair.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I started using this a couple months ago two times a week and I didn’t notice much of a difference. My little spots and acne scars are still there. Not sure what the hype is about CAREFUL it did break me out tho
Can’t stand the rotten meat smell long enough to see it works with regular use. First application I was gagging. Smell it at the store first if possible to see if it works for you.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This definitely works for the darks spots I have on my face. The smell is off putting but it goes away after a while so it's not the worst thing.

reviews.review_title: The answer to all of my pigment questions

reviews.review_text: American made minority owned skin serum. Sulfur is the main ingredient that is helping the pigmentation issues. Sulfur does have an ‘egg’ smell. Sephora should provide more potent products with sulfur in them

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this product to help with hyperpigmentation from old acne scars. However, when I started using it, I started having a lot more acne and the problem just got worse. I followed the instructions to start nice and slow until my skin gets used to it but that didn’t work and it’s been 2 months in and it’s still breaking me out and the hyperpigmentation is worse now. I’m going to stop using it unfortunately.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: So I bought that $40 Hanni razor and it completely destroyed my legs. It bled soo much and my boyfriend was horrified and I had like 15 bandaids all over my legs for days. The scabs turned into dark scars because my skin is super fair and everything turns into a scar on me apparently. I've been using the faded cream for a 2-3 weeks and they've gotten so much lighter I think they'll be hardly noticeable in another 2 weeks. I originally got a small tube in a boxycharm and forgot about it until the hanni incident. I came back for the larger tube after buying the spray, which left orange splotches all over.  Anyways, this stuff works. I use it every day after I shower and I highly recommend it. Also I'm sticking with waxing these days 🙂

reviews.review_title: I really want to love this but....
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really wanted to love this. I hate writing negative reviews but I'm sorry it just didn't do anything for the sun spots on my arms. I didn't mind the smell and the formula is very smooth. I just it faded the dark spots. I hope I am the exception because they are a minority owned company and I really want to support them.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is the second time that I have purchased this product. I am living the result.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have pretty bad acne, not only is this preventing some spots, it clears them up soooo much faster. I found myself replacing my Vit c, because this is so much more effective and erasing those spots quickly!

reviews.review_title: Product contains SULFUR - may break you out
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product has SULFUR in it. Had I known never would have bought it - years ago I used the Mario Badescu drying lotion which if you know also has sulfur in it & that is what triggered my terrible cystic acne for the next 7 years. I used this serum by Topicals thinking it will help all the acne scars left over and my severe hyperpigmentation and the first day after using it I didn't break out however the 2nd day.... I had tiny pimples EVERYWHERE on my face and I'm talking like 10 tiny yellow zits in one spot alone. all over my face. now I know 100% sulfur is not the right ingredient for me I really wanted to like this product and I'm sure it works for other people but there is just too much stuff in this for my sensitive skin. I wish there was less more powerful ingredients than a mix of many.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: It smells absolutely horrid- they really need to do something about that as 80% of the reviews have said that. It works okay I think, honestly I can’t bring myself past the smell. It smells like rotten and it’s so strong I have to try not to breathe while I use id. If the got rid of the terrible smell i’m sure it would be a better product

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin

reviews.review_text: After using it twice a week for about 2 or 3 weeks, then every other night for the last 3 weeks, I've noticed a massive improvement in my skin's overall appearance! Skin now has very little texture, faded hyperpigmentation, and almost zero breakouts where I used to have many. The improvement really came when I began wearing sunscreen during the day. I wasn't expecting it to help with the zits, but am very pleased. I will be purchasing the full size.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This stuff works you have to be consistent and I know everyone is tired of that word but if you use it twice a day on your dark marks and of course use sunscreen you will see results but it dose take a few weeks . I’m on my second tube and I had this large dark mark on my forehead and it’s gone . I believe I first purchased this back in August and I was consistently using it for 3 months then I got lazy because I ran out and then I brought another tube . I promise it’s not like ambi or them other drug store dark spot correcting creams . I use this whit Paula’s choice retinol and it has changed my skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Tan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I don’t get acne. Rarely since puberty. I have a regimen I follow and it never gives me acne. I added this in my routine…smells terrible. But I figured if it will get rid of the scars, who cares. After a couple days of using it, I started getting acne. It stinks, it’s over priced. I wanted to support this black brand but it messed my skin up. And I have pcos so getting rid of acne is not easy. I haven’t had acne in YEARS though. Now i have to get rid of it again. And the scars are still there so yeah thanks for nothing

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Been using this product for about a month now and it helped with my redness but not much on the darkspots. The smell I was able to manage since I know a lot of people have been hating this product because of the smell. Looking at the ingredients there's a lot of good stuff in there! In terms of a lot of acids, it also has hydrating ingredients so it wont dry out your skin. I also found that there is coconut oil in the ingredient list, which made me hesitate since coconut oil does flare up my acne... I would say it doesn't do MUCH but anyone with sunspots, melasma, etc. This will be your ride or die product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: i don't really know what else to say other than the fact that it smells bad, like rotten eggs bad. i get that one of the ingredients has a sulfur-like smell but still. sometimes its so unbearable that i'm gagging. however, it's only been almost 3 weeks of me using. i haven't noticed significant changes. my skin texture does feel a little smoother when i wake up but ill keep using it for a few more weeks to see if my acne scars disappear. if you're sensitive to smells, i wouldn't recommend this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This smells horrendous!  It really does. It's all you can smell once you put it on your face.

reviews.review_title: A staple in my skin care routine

reviews.review_title: We Have To Talk About the SMELL
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Okay so… I just recently purchased this product with high hopes of it helping with post-acne scarring. And I still have high hopes. BUT THE SMELL. It’s bad :( I thought I got a defective tube until reading more reviews mentioning the awful smell as well. Don’t get me wrong - if the product works, I will still use it, but I find myself not wanting to grab for it because I know what I’m in for. I’m highly sensitive to smells so this took me aback a bit, but I’m hoping with continued use I see worthy results & get used to the odor. Just thought it was worth mentioning for anyone who is considering purchasing this product or for those who have any sensitivity to strong scents (or unpleasant ones).

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have tan skin tone and get terrible scarring from anything. There's post-acne scarring, after my sebaceous filaments are gone it leaves scarring, if my cat barely scratches me it leaves the worst dark marks ever. So I wasn't sure that this would work for me but tried it anyway. IT WORKS! Who cares about the scent? This cream has faded a few dark spots I've had on my cheek for maybe 8 months now. I've been using it every other day before bed for one month and there's been a drastic improvement. Holy grail!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Works well but has a smell. I also put some on a freshly squeezed pimple and it dried the spot up.

reviews.review_title: Didn’t work at all for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Photos are three weeks apart, definitely noticed a difference

reviews.review_title: My TRUE holy grail skincare product.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is literally the only product besides tretinoin that has faded my pih. I was on rx hydroquinone and every vitamin c serum I could find including skinceuticals and everything in between, and nothing worked! Hydroquinone works with time but it also dries & irritates, so while your on it you don’t see much happening. *Topicals faded* erraticated a bunch of bad breakouts due to trying new products & 8 red/purple spots in about 4 days. People definitely over exaggerate the scent. It has the scent of sulfur like 4 days after a perm. It’s faint and goes away after a minute & leaves a scent that is amazing! So amazing I was smelling everywhere trying to figure out what it was lol. I’m so glad I didn’t pass on it based on bad reviews. The closest thing I can compare the scent to is head and shoulders dandruff shampoo and if your constantly using sulfur products like me… It won’t phase you. I love that it applies seamlessly and I can use it over my vitamin c and under my serums without pilling AND it doesn’t burn. This stuff is chok full of amazing ingredients. The only thing comparable is peace out skin dark spot serum but that’s not the best choice for trentinoin users with sensitized skin. If you give this a chance and let the scent subside you will definitely see good results. I have acne prone, sensitive, sensitized Tretinoin, combination skin prone to hyperpigmentation and hormonal acne monthly. I’m 35 years old, & this worked wonders for me. I will never ever not have this in my collection, it’s my new holy grail treatment. I can use it for breakouts, it makes my pores look smaller & keeps them clear. I’ve noticed my skin is more firm and the texture is so smooth. I honestly wouldn’t change anything about this serum. You only need a tiny amount because it’s a perfect consistency and spreadable texture so the price is great, especially for the ingredients you get. This is a do all serum. Between this and like butter I don’t need much else.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: So I had a huge purple spot from a cyst under my eye and it was bad. I freaked and decided to try this. I have to say after a few weeks of use it’s almost completely faded. smell is off putting but bearable.

reviews.review_title: Excellent formula and the perfect actives.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It does not stink anymore, I think it is a new formula. It ir a superb combination of ingredients, I’m combo skin  and have a darks spots, but I love I don’t have to use many products to obtain this formula and I’m starting with retinol too. Go slow and let your skin heal with a good moisturizer, I’m using skinfix and doing the skin cicling. Retinol and faded, not at the same time. Retinol-recovery/ faded-recovery.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This stuff works. I’ve never had success with a discoloration product before but this is heaven sent. It definitely smells gross but it does what it says. Using it everyday or every other day will give you the fastest results

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Lots of negative reviews but not everything it for everyone. I haven’t been able to tolerate retinols or vitamin c products and I’ve tried MANY variations. I got a sample of this from a friend about a month ago, and it has improved my skin so much. I recently heard from a dermatologist about the benefits of the individual ingredients in this, and I just happened to have this on hand. I usually get small blemishes and have acne scars/hyperpigmentation and texture. All of it has improved with this product. It definitely has a funky smell (kinda smells like turkey to me!) but it doesn’t persist. I have combination skin but more on the oily side. It’s even helped with oil control throughout the day (I use it in the morning with a sunscreen). If you need an alternative to retinols/vitamin c give this a try. I use it a few times a week.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: okay, so the smell is terrible, like truly awful, plus after 2 weeks of use my skin had way more pigmentation however after 1 month of continued use my freckles are gone. like completely gone, please also remember you have to use with sun screen in order for it to work. It's totally worth it went from a mini to a full size because of how well it worked for my skin.

I would not recommend this to anyone. waste of money.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_title: Smells awful but you get used to it!

reviews.review_text: i have mild rosacea and sometimes develop breakouts on my forehead (little white heads) was curious how this would work as a friend said it did wonders for her! $38 is amazing price for this. it's smelly but doesn't linger. i noticed after one use it reduced my redness and calmed my skin. doesnt irritate and is not drying. try oit!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I don’t mean to be dramatic, but… after using this cream once? Maybe twice? I looked at my skin again in the mirror a week or so later and I’m shocked. Years of cystic acne scares have faded… significantly. I also have a skin picking disorder, those scars have shown significant improvement… I am so hopeful that I will be able to wear V-necks and open-back clothes again without people staring at all my scars and marks. I am not sure what else to say. This tube may be a bit pricey, but I think it will last me several months- reading the directions it says once a week to start or something. The only true con is that one of the ingredients smells funny to me- kind of like a weird popcorn smell. However, if this cream frees me from my scars I’ll smell like “weird popcorn” 24/7. Also take this with a grain of salt because after I had COVID a year ago my sniffer is janky. I hope this product works as well for you as it did for me. 💚

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've used all most every night for a 3 weeks and it definitely is working on my sun spot as it's fading slowly but yes it does smell abit. However after rubbing it in the smell fades some after a couple minutes. The smell isn't a deal breaker for me as long as it works.

I have very sensitive and acne prone skin. ever since i was 11 my skin would break out, to the point where it became pretty severe. Recently my skins been getting more clear because of going to a simple skincare routine. All I have mostly is dark spots from where the bad pimples were. it took me years and years to find something good, and it’s worth it. smell doesn’t bother me, but overall the serum is amazing. the picture on the on the left is before which was 8/19, and the right picture is 9/15.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This topical cream is amazing. I've been using it for almost a month now and my skin has already cleared up so much. I have some freckles around my eyes and forehead that have lightened up A LOT since I started using this. Mind you, I do use retinol as well but I've been using that for like 2 years now and the biggest change on my skin happened after I started using this. I use this at night (alternating nights w retinol).   Cons: smell is pretty bad as everyone has said but you get used to it. The first time I used it I couldn't handle it but now I am used to it. The smell does fade (gets milder; doesn't go away) after a few minutes. Another con is that it is drying my skin. I notice the difference during the day time the following day as my skin feels very dry. Because of that I am not sure if I would be able to use it in the winter.   So far, pretty great. 4.5 stars (-0.5 bc of bad smell and drying effect).

The dark spots on my arm are nearly gone and it’s only been 2 weeks! I plan to use this product for 3-6 months then move on to other parts of my body. I also want to get rid of the strawberry legs I have as well.

This doesnt work as fast, but i have been using it for less than 6 months now and have noticed a very large decrease in my scars. It does have niaciimide which gives me white heads, but it works so well to lighten my dark spots i dont mind. The smell is not that good, but once you put it on you cant really smell it anymore so it doesnt matter too much. Will definitely be buying again. Only issue is the tube is very unforgiving and product tends to spill out and gather around the top which is kind of annoying because of how expensive the product is you end up wasting a bit of it.

reviews.review_text: This stuff is magical! It’s just what my hormonal acne skin needed! I swear it started to work in a day! I apply it at night. I find it to be very hydrating that I only apply this at night and my skin wakes up very happy and clear! It smells like cat food but it is worth having clear skin!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I just love this serum. I was unsure about it when I ordered it based on other reviews and because I had been using other products with niacinamide and tranexamic acid for a while, without seeing many results. I am so glad I tried it anyway! My skin on my cheeks has had significant red and brown acne scarring for quite some time, with large pores and sensitive skin. I've been really self-conscious about it and have been considering laser treatment. This serum seems to have made a huge difference in the time that I've been using it over the past few weeks. My cheeks are even and actually glowing now? Who would have thought. I'm looking at cancelling my laser appointment and waiting to see if the results hold up. I'm so pleased with this product.  I also don't think the smell is that bad, at all. I braced myself when I opened the tube, thinking it would be horrific based on other comments, but it was .. fine? I definitely have used other products that I thought were smellier. I actually considered taking a rapid test because I thought maybe there was something wrong with my smell, but I think it just doesn't bother me as much. Even if it did, the results that it's given me so far would be worth plugging my nose!

reviews.review_title: Have melasma? This witchcraft is for you!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The smell— not the greatest and takes some getting used to (a bit like wet cat and sulphur?). However, if a product delivers results and does what it says it does, I don’t care what it smells like! I will bathe in it! I live in FL and was a sun bunny in my teens, so I have some sun damage across my cheeks, bridge of my nose and upper lip, including some melasma brought on by hormones- so pretty much all over- all of which has been there for the last 20 years (for reference Im fair-skinned and mid 30’s). And let me tell you— ALL of that is nearly gone and this is the most even skin tone I have had in the last two decades. My stubborn melasma is SIGNIFICANTLY lighter and shrinking. I am shocked at how well this works! I had a solid routine before, but when I added this serum into the rotation, it was a game changer. I have been using this consistently for the last 4 months at night 2x/wk alongside Tretinoin 2x/wk, and Vitamin C or Caudalie’s vinoperfect serum in the mornings (and a good SPF, of course). The sun damage on my nose and upper lip is completely gone and the areas on my cheeks have shrunk and lightened by 70%.  I know this is marketed more towards acne and PIH sufferers, but if you have deep, long-standing hyperpigmentation issues, this one is for you too! Hope this helps.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I just started using this so I cant say too much but I just came here to say they mad over dramatic about the smell comments. Its not bad fr i smells good to me lol

reviews.review_text: Dark spots have always been my #1 skin concern. This already has lightened them after a weeks use. The only thing is the smell is so bad I have to hold my breath when I apply it, but still worth it.

reviews.review_text: This is my all time favorite skincare product. It’s the only thing that has helped with both my hyperpigmentation and occasional breakouts. It does smell bad, but it’s a skincare product and not a perfume, so I don’t think it is fair to rate it based on smell. After you rub it in, you can’t smell it anyway. The ingredients are really high quality. I usually use moisturizer afterwards, but I find that I don’t have to use it if I don’t want to when I use this product. It’s enough alone to make my skin feel soft and look glowy. I have noticed a significant reduction in hyperpigmentation ever since I started using this product and I get a lot of compliments on my skin now. I absolutely recommend giving this a try.

reviews.review_text: I never leave reviews but this cleared so much of my hormonal acne literally after 2 uses and faded my uneven skin i will never not use it now

reviews.review_text: Yes, it smells bad. The scent doesn’t last and this product is a medicine in my mind so I don’t mind it. A little goes a long way. My skin isn’t sensitive to it so I can use it twice a day. I haven’t noticed results yet but that could be my individual skin and melasma causes, and nothing to do with the product. Several dermatologists recommend it and the ingredients are all great and work together to treat pigmentation and discoloration. The only thing it doesn’t have is hydroquinone.

reviews.review_text: As a woc, I struggle terribly from post acne scarring that lingers for months but in the short time I've been using this product (about 2.5 weeks) I definitely  notice a difference. Although this serum/cream is quite smelly when applied, its nothing unbearable in my opinion. The results definitely make overlooking the smell a lot easier, plus the smell only lasts a few moments then dissipates

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I had high hopes for this product but it did nothing but break me out even more. I didn’t mind the smell though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: If you are sensitive to bad smells this is not the serum for you. HOWEVER, if you are like me, who struggles with acne and hyperpigmentation and are desperate for something that works, get this NOW. Yes the smell is actually horrible but this stuff works. I have been using this for a few months, I started with once a week and have built up usage to every night and it has done wonders for my hyperpigmentation. I found that most hyperpigmentation products ive used before tend to work on only new spots but have a harder time treating deeper marks. While it takes a little more consistency, this product reaches those longtime spots and even my partner has seen them fade significantly. The only reason why I give this product 4/5 stars is because the smell (which lingers and is horrible) and the packaging which gets bent and mishapen super easily. These two things can be easily forgiven as I have been struggling with acne and hyperpigmentation for most of my life and this is the first product that has made me believe that clear skin might one day be a possibility for me.

reviews.review_title: made my skin look good after a month!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Second time using, made my skin look good. It lasted me about a month, I tried to use it every day and night as part of my skin care routine. The smell is terrible but you get used to after a while. I got the small size, thinking about getting a bigger size next time.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Smells like eggs on steroids. Made me break out at first. But it’s incredible really no other discoloration fighting product compares. My dark spots faded within a few weeks with consistent use. Just remember to moisturize in the AM and PM and stay indoors when you do use it the night before because it does make your skin sensitive at first.

reviews.review_title: worse product I’ve ever smelled in my life
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_title: Smells so bad, not for me

reviews.review_title: 2 stars removed for smell and packaging

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I can see a visible change every time I use this but it smells Like nair.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, gray hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin

Now I'm laughing because the smell is reminiscent of burnt sage--the smell that lingers after you burn sage to eliminate negative energy from a room. It is quite pleasant, IMO.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
